learn.transactions.description: The foundation of expense tracking. Every transaction tells the story of money moving in or out.
learn.transactions.tip1: Add transactions regularly for accurate tracking
learn.transactions.tip2: Use clear descriptions to remember what each transaction was for
learn.transactions.tip3: Income transactions increase your balance, expenses decrease it
learn.wallets.description: Represent your money sources - bank accounts, cash, credit cards, or any place you store money.
learn.wallets.tip1: Start with your main bank account
learn.wallets.tip2: Add all your payment methods for complete tracking
learn.wallets.tip3: Update balances regularly to stay accurate
learn.categories.description: Group similar transactions to understand spending patterns and financial habits.
learn.categories.tip1: Use specific categories like "Coffee" instead of generic "Food"
learn.categories.tip2: Create both income and expense categories
learn.categories.tip3: Don't create too many - keep it manageable
learn.parties.description: People or businesses you exchange money with. Helps track relationships and spending patterns.
learn.parties.tip1: Add your employer for salary tracking
learn.parties.tip2: Include frequent merchants like grocery stores
learn.parties.tip3: Use parties to identify spending habits with specific vendors
learn.quicktips.quickentry: Use the "Add Transaction" button in the navbar for fastest entry from anywhere in the app.
learn.quicktips.dashboard: Your dashboard shows the big picture - total income, expenses, and net balance at a glance.
learn.quicktips.search: Use search and filters to find specific transactions or analyze spending patterns.
learn.quicktips.mobile: Trakli works great on mobile - add transactions on the go whenever you spend money.
learn.quicktips.consistent: Regular tracking leads to better insights. Try to add transactions daily or weekly.
learn.quicktips.simple: Begin with basic categories and wallets. You can always add more detail as you get comfortable.
learn.faq.q1: How often should I add transactions?
learn.faq.a1: For best results, add transactions daily or weekly. The more frequently you track, the more accurate your financial picture becomes.
learn.faq.q2: What's the difference between wallets and categories?
learn.faq.a2: Wallets represent WHERE your money is (bank account, cash, credit card). Categories represent WHAT you spent money on (food, transport, salary).
learn.faq.q3: Do I need to add every small transaction?
learn.faq.a3: It depends on your goals. For complete tracking, yes. But if you prefer, you can set a minimum amount (like $5) and only track larger expenses.
learn.faq.q4: How do I handle transfers between accounts?
learn.faq.a4: Create two transactions: one expense from the source account and one income to the destination account, using the same amount.
learn.faq.q5: Can I edit or delete transactions?
learn.faq.a5: Yes! Click on any transaction to edit its details, or use the delete option if you added something by mistake.
learn.faq.q6: What if I forget to add transactions?
learn.faq.a6: No problem! You can add past transactions by changing the date. Try to catch up weekly to stay current.

carousel.simple.title: Simple
carousel.simple.text: Trakli focuses on the basics and gives just what you need to see where your money is coming from or going to.
carousel.automated.title: Automated
carousel.automated.text: Get your income and expense report completed automatically using your emails and SMS or other custom workflows you setup.
carousel.opensource.title: Open Source
carousel.opensource.text: Trakli is open source! You can use all Trakli features at no cost on your self-hosted instance.
